name: Invariant subspace problem
rephrased: Does every continuous operator on a complex vector space with completeness (Banach space) have a subspace (other than zero or the whole space) that it maps to itself?
explained: The Invariant Subspace Problem is a fundamental question in functional analysis. It asks whether every bounded linear operator T acting on a complex Banach space X has a non-trivial closed invariant subspace. In other words, is there always a closed subspace Y of X (other than {0} and X itself) such that T(Y) âŠ† Y?
